lines.text:
[praying to Buddha]
Buddha, please help Anna keep awake for scientific preparation of banquet, even though she is a woman and a Christian and therefore unworthy of your interest.
[Anna looks indignantly at the King]

[holding a vase of flowers]
For your room, Mrs. Anna.
Oh, how lovely!
[Tuptim looks at poetry book]
Oh, you must have something in return.
Oh no, Mrs. Anna, you will be punished for giving book to servant!

[giving Tuptim the poetry book]
Oh, nonsense, I'm a teacher.
If we stay, death. If we go to Burma, death. We have no country to go to.
We make our own country, in jungle.
[after Anna has just received a house outside the palace]
I'm speechless.
For once!
[when Louis is hiding behind his mother in fright]
Never hide behind woman's skirt, it's not brave. Also, impossible to know when she sit down!

[holding a crossbow]
Hey, do these things still...
[crossbow accidentally goes off and narrowly misses Master Little]
...work? Sorry.
Good thing Master Little so little...
Oh! I get it, Oh Corporate One... we are going to be rich, aren't we?

[sniffs]
Well... I am.
The Kralahome very good at Kralahoming!
[when walking on roof and Louis follows]
Not for boy, you'll get hurt.
That's what you said about kick-boxing - and I bloodied your nose!
Someday, you too will know everything.
When do I know that I know everything?
When you are king.

[dictating to Master Little, who will then send the dictation to Edward Ramsey]
To Sir Edward Ramsey, your schoolteacher is in great danger, etc, etc.

[excitedly]
Etc? Ooh, is that a secret code?

[teaching King's children]
I have a surprise. A new, modern, British map.
[Anna unrolls map out on wall]
Siam is not so *small!*
Oh but look, England's even smaller.

[all at once]
Ah!
But royal palace is centre of whole universe.
Well, I suppose we think that of all our homes really - whether you live in a palace or not.
